comments: I would tell future students that in order to take this course you must have a genuine interest in the language. Very much outside research and study in needed to do well in the course.
Even if you are a somewhat fluent speaker of Igbo, you might find the course helpful. It gives you the ability to write  Igbo and know the mechanics of the language.
If you want to learn Igbo this is the place to come.
Definitely take this class! The course material is great and the teacher does an amazing job.
It is easy but there isn't much direction.
Take this course!
Great course, and Nneka is a great teacher.
Be prepared to use the Igbo you have learned in this class. The teacher doesn't respond to English most times.
Relax and enjoy your time; it's probably the only class that will let you breathe.
This is a great course and anyone considering taking it should definitely do so!
It is a fun course to take, and you leave with a better understanding of the Igbo language.

It is a unique opportunity to start with basic Igbo, but unless you have a strong support system of Igbo speakers around you, you will learn very little. Unless the class is improved fundamentally through putting in a clear structure and teaching pedagogy to, it ends up as a bit of a waste of time. I could have learned ten times as much if there had been structure to this class.
Make sure you do the homework
Learning this language is great. The professor is great and she makes the learning environment very enjoyable.
Amazing!! you'll actually have fun while learning.
Good class

The new 3-day-a-week lecture schedule, the new teacher's difficulty teaching, and an unorganized course structure made Igbo Semester 1, year 1, unfortunate for all students.  We did enjoy classes with Nneka, and some of the cultural aspects were fun, but the unclear direction of the class, disconnected and somewhat disorganized lectures by the assistant teachers, and the arbitrary grading made the class unpleasant.  I ended the semester feeling like I had scarcely progressed in learning the language.
Be patient from the beginning. The language can be a bit nuanced, but by learning from the beginner level one has the chance to become pretty good at it by second or third year.
This course is great. You will learn very much from taking this course because the professors are very knowledgeable and love to teach.
- It is amazing how quickly you learn to speak a language in a creative environment that fosters your learning.
Great language
Be careful oooh. Nawa for you oooh.
great class
This course is amazing. The small class setting allows for great conversation and it fosters a great learning environment.

Be prepared to be challenged, but have a lot of fun as well. The African Language program takes great care to make sure the students are enjoying their classes and continue to take them. With Igbo Nneka tries to make sure the students are learning about culture as well by tying in stories and even days when we all cook Nigerian food. This makes for a very engaging and fruitful class.
Prepare for disorganization. Ask a lot of questions in advance and put in work if you really want to learn.
This class produces a very good environment for practicing Igbo.
Really really fast paced
This class is fun and awesome and you get to learn a lot of Igbo in the process!
Great way to broaden your horizons.
Its a great class.
This class is very intimate, so you must be fully prepared for each section meeting.
Take this class and learn Igbo!
It brings the real Igbo experience right to you in class!
African classes are a good way to flexibly learn a language without having hard grading constraints. If you have the opportunity to take one, do it!

Its a great opportunity to learn an African language (besides like Swahili) in a structured forum. Take advantage! But bear in mind, for languages like this, there is limited infrastructure, so depending on your previous experience with the language and other foreign language experiences, this will *not* be like learning Spanish or French. A lot of your learning will be co-creating methodology/materials that are helpful rather than having a vast range of resources and just making use of them
great!
It is a great opportunity to get in touch with your cultural side!
Great class. Take this if you are Igbo and do not know the language! You will not regret this decision.
Its great; come in with an open mind.
Great class for the self motivated.
This is class great! Take it, I would recommend it as a 5th class though, because it is really low key and you learn a lot.
good class to take to fulfill language requirement and to learn about another part of the world.
good class
Do the weekly reports.
Its the best language in the ALP.
Take it!!!! You get to learn and practice Igbo. It's especially useful if you're thinking of going to the continent some day.

if you didn't know what a word meant you either had to email him or ask your parents. This teacher is basically all the annoying parts of a Nigerian uncle, but he's also cool and like a brother to the guys. But if you're a girl than yea he's mostly Nigerian uncle status. The class if fun though sometimes when i doesn't drag on for 2 hours but there are lots of laughs and it is funny when he tells stories about the homeland : ) Also, he will stress that "we are igbo people here" so that sense of community was nice too. But then we would have a quiz and it got old real fast. I really do feel like I learned at least more than I did before. Could I have a conversation in Igbo now? Psh nope. But I can pick out words when my parents are speaking and now I have the basics down so I'm pretty confident that if I keep with it I might actually gain a lot!
Its an easy way to fulfill your language requirement.

The class is a great way to learn culture and the Igbo language. There seems to be more and more Nigerians I know and knowing their culture can be very important as African culture is usually not focussed on in school or in regular American society.
This class is a great way to balance out your schedule with other very difficult classes. It is very interesting to learn an African language and I think you should take this class!
It is very unorganized.
Have fun. Do your Language Reports! This course is what you make of it. Try your best and you'll most likely come out with more Igbo knowledge than you began with.
It is just an awesome course! You learn so much about the Igbo culture.
This class is great!

The professor tended to go on tangents often and assign work sometimes that was more difficult than what we had been taught at the time, but if you are like me (and almost everyone else in my class)of Igbo descent but don't know the language, then taking Igbo is something you should really consider doing.
It's an easy A if you do your assignments and show up to class.
If you can deal with an unstructured class go ahead and join. It's very chill though like there's not a lot of pressure. Take it if you genuinely have an interest.
This class is really great if you want to learn a few common words and learn about Igbo culture. If you are already good at Igbo or can understand it, you may be bored in this class.

This class is what you make of it. If you want to learn conversational Igbo, take the class seriously and practice what you learn in class. It is easy to go through the motions but that is a waste of time. The professor makes the material very manageable but it is up to you to make the class a "good experience." Definitely glad I took it!
Take Igbo! No matter your proficiency level, there is a strong support system, and if there's any chance you'll be going to Nigeria sometime, this will definitely come in handy.

You will et what you put into this course. I had the pleasure of taking Igbo with Mazi Onaga for 2 semesters. He is incredibly passionate about the Igbo language, and will go the extra mile to support you in the learning process (in and out of the classroom).
Its hard like any language but it is really cool when you actually get to learn it.
This is the best class in the African Language Program.
Good course!
it is a great experience
It is a great class environment with very few students in your class and an authentic Igbo teacher who lives the culture.
The course is a very good way to become immersed in a culture removed from the Harvard bubble which so often traps us in a specific, closed way of thinking.
Class works great for an elective or a language, Professor Onaga is great.
If you want to learn about a very interesting culture of Africa, this is the way to go.
I'm glad I took this course because I know this might have been my only opportunity to learn my dad's native language (and I know this might be the case for other students).
That it is a unique opportunity to learn a unique and different, interesting language.
It is a relatively easy course and you do learn a fair amount of Igbo however it is not very structured which is tough.
For Igbo students: this class can be a really great way to get back in touch with a part of your culture. For non-Igbo students: this class is an awesome way to learn about a new culture and people.
you get what you put in
Take it! It's awesome, and the teacher Stella Ihenetu is wonderful!
If you have the opportunity, absolutely take this class.  It extremely interesting, fun, and not too challenging.  I can't recommend any class more highly.
Definitely take this course if 1. Your are Igbo and want to learn more about your culture and language or 2. You just want to learn more about the Igbo culture even if you aren't Igbo yourself.
This class teaches you more than just a language. You will learn about a culture you might know nothing about.
This class is solid. Had a lot of fun staying connected to my culture throughout the semester. Such a nice way to learn more about Igbo.
I didn't learn as much Igbo as I would have liked, but it's a goof class to take that is not as stressful as the other languages
review each week's materials
this class is awesome and I strongly encourage it!
AMAZING way speak and learn about Nigeria
Ask for help if you need it!
you do not need prior knowledge, it is a good class to take to lighten your course load
If you aren't passionate or at least interested in actually learning the Igbo language and knowing more about the Igbo culture then please do not take this course.
It is not as organized as the other languages in the African Languages Program. This course may be only useful to students who have a background in Igbo.
Really invest your time and energy into this class because you can learn a lot about Nigeria as a nation and its place in the World.
Amazing Course please take it
Worth it if Nigerian

You probably won't walk out of this class with fluency in Igbo. However, you will be able recognize more words than you could before and learn more about the culture. You will learn Igbo to a point and then plateau and the course is really tailored towards people who come from Igbo backgrounds. That said, if you are looking for a class to easily complete your language requirement with little stress this is the class for you.
Course was fun, not too heavy, and enjoyable!
